answers.answer: Hi there,Regular periods are a marker of female health and a normal cycle is important for getting pregnant. Women with irregular periods or no period at all may find it difficult to conceive .You need to get investigated for your irregular periods. Diabetes, thyroid disorders, previous history of STIs leading to scarring, ovulation disorders all can result in irregular menstrual cycles. You will need tests to rule out above mentioned possibilities. Consult a gynecologist. I sincerely hope it helps. Do keep us posted.Best of luck and regards!

question: What should I do Ive been trying to get pregnant for about six months my period is not regular and i really want a baby im getting married very soon any suggesttens on what i can do to improve my chance?
title: TTC
